website_summaries.verdict: This oat-based creamer adds a hint of oat flavor to coffee and chai. Plus it can be steamed and foamed, although results are mixed.
pros: Made from domestically- grown rolled oats
Unsweetened recipe is gluten-free, nut-free and allergen free
The formula doesn't add a lumpy or gritty texture, and it doesn't separate
cons: Many customers noted that the oat milk didn't froth like they had expected

customer_reviews.title: Oat milk is the milk we never knew we needed.
customer_reviews.text: Oat milk is the truth! Of all the milks I’ve tried, oat milk makes the BEST lattes. Creamy, sweet, and perfectly textured for pairing with coffee. It’s macronutrient composition is higher in carbohydrates than fats than traditional creamers, which gives you a rich and creamy drinking experience- without being oily in any sense. I’ve attempted, and failed, many times to make my own (it always slimes within minutes) This oat milk isn’t as thick or flavorful as others I’ve tried, but it works wonderfully with coffee and foams, and stays, amazingly. I’m so glad oat milk is gaining popularity, hopefully it’ll be a staple in stores and coffee shops soon!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Bwire

customer_reviews.title: Amazing dairy replacement!
customer_reviews.text: Such an amazing replacement for dairy! Taste just like milk and has such a nice semi thick rich smooth tase! Never drinking anything else but oat! It’s made out of whole roll oats, dairy free, no sugars added! Vegan friendly, gluten free, nut free, kosher. Califa has so many more amazing products to enjoy such as almond milk flavored creamers. I prefer to use this with a hint of blue agave syrup. Refrigerate after opening or prior.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Best oat milk yet
customer_reviews.text: My favorite oat milk so far! Would highly recommend. The sugar content is a lot less than other oat milks I’ve tried. Will order again.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Delicious
customer_reviews.text: Love the flavor and nutritional values in comparison to Oatly and Pacific brand Barista oat milk. Only thing this lacks is it does not froth well when heated compared to the other brands. For the price I’ll make the exception. I use also with cold brew and it’s darn good.
customer_reviews.author: Dexter

customer_reviews.title: really good chilled
customer_reviews.text: I am using this particular milk blend in my morning bowl of cereal. So the taste is blending in with my corn flakes nicely. I am sure it must taste even better when used for the primary purpose, in your latte. But for me I am just really digging the smoothness of this oat milk. As I always say in all my reviews of food...taste is in the mouth of the user.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce D.

customer_reviews.title: No soy for me
customer_reviews.text: What a great, somewhat sweet (naturally) dairy-free "milk." Doesn't "froth" like dairy, but tastes really good in coffee, on cereal, and in baking. Best case price I've found so far.
customer_reviews.author: Picky Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Not what I hoped for. It may work if you have a powerful steamer on a commercial espresso machine -- which is probably what this is made for. But I could not get it to froth at all. (The equipment I have does froth other brands of almond milk okay.) It is no thicker than regular almond milk, not like half-and-half as some reviewers said, and yes, I did shake the container before opening. The taste is mediocre and cane sugar is the second ingredient, 5 g per serving. My error for not reading the label carefully. It also has less calcium than other brands. I'll use it up somehow, but won't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Rosanne Davis

customer_reviews.title: Customer for life
customer_reviews.text: I had some doubts because I've tried many milk replacements and all of them were nasty to me. This one is DELICIOUS! I love the taste its smooth and soft. I will be buying again and again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Masters

customer_reviews.title: Oat milk is the creamiest non-dairy milk I have tried
customer_reviews.text: I love oat milk. I have already been through 2 of these containers since I got them last week. I like it with cereal, in coffee, and honestly it is amazing on it's own. I also use it to mix with my supergreen powders which works very very well. I have tried nut milks and they are okay, but not thick/creamy enough for me. (When I drink dairy milk, I am a Whole Milk lover). I truly enjoy this flavor. Now that I have found it I honestly may not go back to dairy milk.
customer_reviews.author: strawb1207

customer_reviews.title: Best oat milk
customer_reviews.text: This specific oat milk has the best texture/consistency and is the only thing I use in my coffee. Try it with coffee, it’s the best. This is my favorite oat milk and I was making too many trips to whole foods just to restock on this. Glad I was able to buy multipack here.
customer_reviews.author: Mahawish Zaidi

customer_reviews.title: Obsessed!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this yesterday and just received it today February 12. All the containers seem to be intact with a good expiration date and nothing has been punctured or damaged. I’m super excited to be able to order this through Amazon since it’s not easily found in every supermarket that I have checked. This is my favorite oat milk to use with my coffee when I make my iced lattes or cappuccinos.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't froth
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have a dairy intolerance (whey and everything). I was really excited because I bought a Keurig that froths milk on here and this is supposed to be good for that. It's not! It doesn't froth up at all! Like nothin'! That's the whole reason I bought it. Now I have a big case of it and it won't get used. I wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Be sweet!

customer_reviews.title: Downright Delicious
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 6 pack for the first time after trying it at The Commissary in Burbank, CA. I was in love with the flavor as soon as I tried it with matcha and a dash of honey. I want to use it as a coffee creamer sometime soon but for now this is the best self-sustaining plant based milk out there for me. My local grocer is always sold out of Planet Oat Milk so this makes it easy for me to get in 2 days. I'll be adding this to my Subscribe & Save for sure. Try it out!
customer_reviews.author: Morning Star

customer_reviews.title: Good but just be aware
customer_reviews.text: This oat milk has added sunflower oil in it, if you care about added oils (say for your heart) it might not be the one you want. Pacific doesn't have any added oil, my husband likes Pacific's taste better it's sweeter and I like the Califia taste but still I would like to skip the oil. I did not steam it so can not attest to that. I didn't check the ingredients label as I usually do, so this is what happens.
customer_reviews.author: veggiemama

customer_reviews.title: Okay flavor and texture.  Sometimes seems too greasy.
customer_reviews.text: I really want to like this as a creamer. The texture is okay. I like strong coffee and I find it masks the taste of the coffee and creates a drink that is not quite what I consider coffee. I haven't tried it in tea. I tend to drink coffee cold a lot and that works pretty well, but when I heat it I notice a lot of fat floating on the top. Not appealing. A quart is on the pricey saide to me, but subscribe and save helps. I am still using it, until I find another that is better.
customer_reviews.author: Nettie Scott

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't froth and has no flavor
customer_reviews.text: The oat milk doesn't even froth. The only reason I bought this milk was because it was advertised as being barista oat milk with special ingredients that make the milk ideal for preparing lattes and cappuccinos. What's worse is it barely heats up and the flavor is extremely bland. I regret this purchase and now I'm stuck with 5 unopened boxes of this milk that I have no clue what to do with.
customer_reviews.author: Esraa

customer_reviews.title: Creamy and Delectable Oat Milk! Best Substitute for Regular Milk
customer_reviews.text: Califia Farms' barista version of oat milk is creamier than its regular one (usually sold in the fridge section). This one also froths easier. It froths well in a blender or milk frother! I usually use oat milk to make lattes - matcha, turmeric, thai tea, or cafe lattes. It has a nice nutty flavor and pairs well with all the drinks. When I use this milk, I add less sugar to my drinks because there is a hint of sweetness. Moreover, I notice that the milk cuts down on the bitterness of coffee due to its high fat content. Nestle instant coffee is very bitter - other than regular milk, this oat milk makes the coffee very tolerable.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Lam

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t foam well
customer_reviews.text: The store was already out of the refrigerated oat milk which foamed really well for me. I figured this would foam even better, but it doesn’t really foam at all. I am glad to have alot of it during the Quarantine time because I can’t leave my place and can’t get any deliveries scheduled. But I really prefer the original one in the refrigerator.
customer_reviews.author: diy freak

customer_reviews.title: The Best Non-Dairy Creamer But We Need ORGANIC
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best non dairy creamer for coffee because it tastes just like real dairy. Too bad they dont make an organic version. Oats typically have the pesticide glyphosate (Monsanto's RoundUp weed killer) and unfortunately even organic oat products have tested for glyphosphate. PLEASE Califa, make a safe organic version which does not test for glyphosphate! And help fight cancer.
customer_reviews.author: Sheeba

customer_reviews.title: Very good taste!
customer_reviews.text: Great taste!!!!! Oh I've never have such good oat milk before. It is way better than the oat milk from Trader Joe's -- too sweet with 9g added sugar. And this one only contains 3 added sugar -- exactly a proper amount. (If too less, you will feel it tough in your mouth.) I bought 6 boxes during sale, and you don't need to keep them in the fridge until you open it. A little bit more expensive than the oat milk I bought in grocery stores, but it worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: suwangcn

customer_reviews.title: Tastes Good But Inconsistent in Shelf Life
customer_reviews.text: We first bought this product on March 16 and, as expected, it came with a long expiration date of October 2. We ordered it again on May 29, ten weeks later and this time the expiration date was only October 16. We buy this product for its long shelf life. So, ordering a second time, ten weeks after the first order, only gained us two more weeks before expiration. Something is wrong here. That's the problem with buying products online that have expiration dates. We're very disappointed in Califia Farms.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: I miss my better half 😭.  This is not comparable 👎.
customer_reviews.text: I tried to save some money and bought this instead of the Califia Farms better half and am so disappointed. The picture is my coffee with like 1/2 cup, a third of the whole thing, and it just tastes watery, not creamy. The better half one makes my coffee nice and creamy with less than half the amount. Also, as a coffee creamer the taste is blah. I am so bummed now I have six cartons of this oat blah to get through before I reorder the good stuff. Perhaps this is fine if using it as an oat milk, not creamer. I really miss my better half 😭👎
customer_reviews.author: Maui

customer_reviews.title: Good cow's milk replacer
customer_reviews.text: It's a great replacement for cow's milk or half & half cream.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Owen-Fugere

customer_reviews.title: A good buy
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 5/20/20 & received 5/21/20 with use by date of Oct 2020. I would have appreciated at least a 6 mos. window for these 6 boxes. This was a great purchase at 21$, given that my local retailer charges 7$ a carton! The taste is creamy and smooth when added to my Folgers 1850 Sumatran coffee (also a great buy on Amazon). The oat milk froths well enough for my liking in my frother (also purchased here on Amazon).
customer_reviews.author: Amazongirl

customer_reviews.title: A flat gray
customer_reviews.text: The purpose of a barista style dairy free milk, is to experience the creamy frothiness of dairy milk in a hot beverage without the dairy. This is non-dairy, but besides that it is nothing more than normal almond milk. It barely makes a froth, and it never can hold it. Where is the foam? Where is the creaminess? Where is the full-bodied latte experience? Not here. I will use for cold and hot cereal, but as a milk for a nice coffee, no thanks.
customer_reviews.author: GLEN

customer_reviews.title: Bad Product, Doesn’t Work, Unethical Seller
customer_reviews.text: HORRIBLE PRODUCT!!! Does not taste good and does not steam correctly at all!!! No foam, just a disgusting mess!!! I asked to be refunded and the seller refused. Stay away from this product and this seller!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: Totally obsessed
customer_reviews.text: I can't get enough of this product. I was a huge half/half fan until I discovered my dairy allergy. UGH. I thought it was the end of the world... well, it kind of still is, because I can't find a solid non-dairy brie replacement.... BUT back to Califia Oatmilk Barista Blend. I LOVE IT. I can't drink coffee without it. I've starting putting it in my tea, and I cut it will a little water and use it in cereal too. Sooooo good! I can't recommend it enough.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Beth Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Can’t run out of this beverage!
customer_reviews.text: We try to minimize our dairy intake, several of us are lactose intolerant. Although we must admit we like the taste of cow‘a milk. And we also love coca-cola. But we know how bad it is to health. We’ve tried many milk alternatives for beverage: Hemp, Soy, Coconut, Almond. Nothing had staying power in our fridge. This oat milk turned out to be a big winner. The taste is great. We love that it’s sweetness is very mild. I forgot if it is 6 or 9 grams of sugar per serving. We feel comfortable to have more than one cup per day.
customer_reviews.author: Skypop

customer_reviews.title: Much creamier than unsweetened almond milk
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try oat milk after learning that almond production in California is harmful to bees. I was hopeful -- and I was not disappointed! I use it in my coffee and tea and that's my only use of it so far. It tastes creamy compared to almond milk. It's a bit more expensive than almond milk but worth it to know bees aren't being harmed.
customer_reviews.author: Ms_Jade_Li

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to using this Barista blend almond milk to steam for lattes, as I wanted a creamy texture latte. When I steamed it in my espresso machine at home it was very watery and didn't create the creamy texture that I was after. In fact, all other almond milks I've used were a much better result (my favorite being Almond Breeze by BlueDiamond). For an almond milk that is made for steaming, I found it very disappointing. Will not be reordering in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Very good in milk based espresso drink
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to stop drinking cow's milk and tried oat milk, this is very good and excellent in my latte's but the price is pretty hard to swallow. Hopefully the price will come down as popularity increases as its been doing the past year or two. I tried some cheaper oat milk's (silk brand) from the local grocery store in my lattes and the taste was not good, very nutty taste, it was fine like in cereal just not in steamed/frothed drinks.. it was similar to what almond milk tastes like when frothed, which to me was no good. I am going to try Oatley brand next (which is what Starbucks uses).
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for the Califia Oat milk but having used the Oatly brand barista edition before, it just didn’t compare in taste or quality. The Califia oatmilk isn’t nearly as creamy and has kind of an almost nutty taste to it. Also there was chunks floating around in my coffee too despite me shaking really well so that was kind of gross. Just wasn’t impressed. I’m sticking with Oatly.
customer_reviews.author: CooneyFam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all around but the thickness
customer_reviews.text: My only qualms with this product is that it isn’t thick or creamy enough to be a creamy for hot coffee. You have to add quite a lot of it to hot coffee to use as a creamer. It makes excellent blended iced coffee for sure. It is also delicious by itself as a glass of almond milk. Highly recommend this product for coffee, smoothies, and cow milk replacement.
customer_reviews.author: JesSica

customer_reviews.title: Was surprised at how good this was.
customer_reviews.text: I own a coffee roaster, coffee shop/cafe, and bought this on a whim. Definitely did not disappoint. Blended well in cold coffee drinks, and excellent frothing when used in lattes, cappuccinos and any other hot espresso drinks. Great flavor, but is very “oaty “ Personally preferred over almond milk or soy.
customer_reviews.author: CoffeeQueen

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but quality
customer_reviews.text: Man this stuff is delicious. It's creamy and has a pleasant subtle oat taste that is masked with tea. I don't have a fancy machine to froth or make dalgonas but I would imagine it would work great. The only thing is the price point - as a grad student I will probably not buy again but if I had the money I definitely would.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: A NEED for At-Home Baristas with Espresso Makers!
customer_reviews.text: Barista branded plant milks really do make a HUGE difference! The consistency is thick and creamy and slightly has a sweet taste (oatmilk naturally seems to do that). This foams up really well, the bubbles are a lot smaller than using regular or homemade oatmilk, and it stays thick, not watery at all. Also of course, the creaminess/thickness does not leave you congested like other milk or even sometimes coconut milk. I am ecstatic about this purchase and am very thankful to the creators, thank you. All in all, you need to try this!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn S.

customer_reviews.title: Been good but went bad
customer_reviews.text: This was my fave oat milk but lately either the production went wrong or something else happend, this milk had some oil in it. I have been using it for a while and while I did not ask for a refund for last order I did for current one as it is impossibke yo use. I really loved this oat milk. Aside from current oily issues it tastes really good. I use it for my coffee mostly. It foams well. It tastes great by itself too.
customer_reviews.author: Anetta

customer_reviews.title: Does not foam well in frother.  Goes completely flat.
customer_reviews.text: "Barista Blend" is misleading. It implies good foaming properties, and good foaming properties are stated in the description. Nothing could be further from the truth. I tried it multiple times, both room temp and cold. Also compared very unfavorably to other brands with "barista" in the title. Flat, flat, flat.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service, great product.
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I love this product. Blends perfectly into coffee, and isn’t watery like a lot of oat milks tend to be. It functions like CoffeeMate creamer but without the overwhelming flavor. Secondly, I received outstanding customer service from the seller! I had accidentally entered in my work address instead of home, and I contacted the seller regarding the nagged after the item had shipped and was only one day away. The seller contacted fedex for me and got the item rerouted to my home address. Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Joy

customer_reviews.title: Best tasting oat milk
customer_reviews.text: Very pleasant taste, especially when I froth it in my coffee ( I have never liked the taste of almond milk in my coffee). I use it in my smoothies as well as my turmeric milk at night. Oat milk has more calories than almond milk, but for me it’s worth it and this brand is especially worth it. Other brands do not taste nearly as good.
customer_reviews.author: Philip N. Spofford III

customer_reviews.title: So Bland
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the vanilla creamer, both last time and this time; it is incredibly delicious! However I received this dull, watery, tasteless Califia Farms Unsweetened Almondmilk Barista Blend. Now my order history shows this is what I ordered last time too. Sorry Califia, but I will not recommend this product, and I will not be ordering this brand, Califia, again .
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: great stuff
customer_reviews.text: I really love this in my smoothies it blends very nicely and has a great flavor. I have not tried it before because I love half-and-half in my coffee and because it said barista I thought that was what it was for -- until I read other reviews. I have not tried it in coffee and kind of doubt that I'd like it but for every other need that I would want I'm in luck for this is better than anything I've had. Also the stability on the shelf is a huge factor to be able to keep some on hand.
customer_reviews.author: byebird

customer_reviews.title: Great taste- Causes tummy distress for me
customer_reviews.text: There is an ingredient - Tricalcium phosphate- and dipotassium phosphate- that is known for causing tummy upset and it did for me. Copied from pubmed: What are the side effects of dipotassium phosphate? Common side effects may include: nausea, vomiting, stomach pain, diarrhea; bone or joint pain; headache, dizziness, tired feeling; muscle pain or weakness; increased thirst; or. numbness or tingly feeling.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Bradeen

customer_reviews.title: The BEST non dairy milk out there!
customer_reviews.text: This oat milk is the closest thing to real milk we have tried! we love it on cereal, in coffee- anywhere you would normally use dairy. Ingredients: water, non GMO oats, sunflower oil, minerals (dipotassium phosphate, calcium carbonate, tricalcium phosphate) and sea salt. WE HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: jack g

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed after buying a case of this- it does not ...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed after buying a case of this- it does not foam. I have a very good frother which produces excellent results with other almond milk brands. I really like the Pacific brand Barista series almond milk, but was looking for a less expensive alternative. When I saw the Califia brand on Amazon , with "Barista" on the carton, I thought this would be worthwhile. For those of you contemplating this brand, do not buy it if you plan on heating up the milk and frothing it by hand. In my opinion this should not be called Barista, that is somewhat misleading. I found many similar reviews after making the purchase. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: CheriNYC

customer_reviews.title: Opening Act
customer_reviews.text: PLEASE, OH PLEASE MAKE YOUR MILK & CREAMER CONTAINERS EASIER TO OPEN. HONESTLY, I HAVE A HORRIBLE TIME TRYING TO OPEN A NEW BOTTLE BECAUSE THE OPENING IS TILTED DOWNWARD BETWEEN TWO "EARS". THOSE EARS CAUSE ME TO DAMAGE THE HOLE FOR POURING MILK & i HAVE TO PUT BOTTLE OF MILK INTO A JAR W/LID. THIS SOUNDS DUMB PROBABLY BUT I AM SERIOUSLY THINKING OF CHANGING BRANDS BECAUSE OF THIS PROBLEM. EVERYONE DOESN'T HAVE SMALL & THIN HANDS.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley A. Little

customer_reviews.title: My offical go-to
customer_reviews.text: I've fallen in love with this oat milk creamer as of late. I used to be an almond milk latte type, although almond milk is much more thin and the almond flavor can be a bit over powering. I've tried probaly every Oat milk creamer out there and this is the one! its rich, tastey, and always makes for a great cup of coffee, hot or iced. Just bought the 6 pack and will be making this a regular part of my grocery routine now! LOVE IT
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Great plant based option
customer_reviews.text: It did everything I could have hoped for but it wasn’t dairy based It worked amazing in both hot and iced coffee. Not sweet or weird tasting at all. Was just as white as regular milk is. And this 6 pack saved me from going to the store for about 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Erinn

customer_reviews.title: Amazing taste!
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite oat milks! I wish the box was a little more like the almond milk packaging. This one is a little bit more harder to open. Besides that, oat milk is creamy and tasty! One of the best alternatives out there! (Hopefully comes out with a chocolate version someday!)
customer_reviews.author: Bianca

customer_reviews.title: Great deal, iffy delivery
customer_reviews.text: I love this oat milk—it's great for lattes, cereal and baking, plus perfect for other cooking needs like sauces because it's not sweet. My only gripe is that of the few times I've order this pack, it once came with one of the cartons punctured and it leaked all over the box and our floor. Not the end of the world because this is relatively inexpensive, but pretty annoying to be shorted one carton. And as far as I can tell, there is no way to request a replacement—you can only send in for returns, which feels ridiculous to have to send in five perfectly fine oat milks just to get one replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Over powering oat flavor that will mess with the taste of your drinks and food.
customer_reviews.text: I tried making chai tea latte and macaroni and cheese with this oat milk, and it messed up the flavors of these two items badly. I've never had problems with chobani oat milk before, but I couldn't find the kind I wanted on here and I saw how economical this was and decided to buy it. It's just not for me. For someone that wants an oat milk with a strong oat flavor, this is right up your alley.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not cheap, but is really good for lattes
customer_reviews.text: I drink this in my morning mocha my wife, a former professional barista, makes for me. It is really tasty, steams up great, and has a nice rich flavor. Unlike other non-dairy "milk" this one is far more sustainable since it is based on oats. Oats are planted and harvested all in one season, do not use a ton of water, do not required much in the way of pesticides or fungicides, do not kill bees in their production, and are very plentiful.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: not the best
customer_reviews.text: This is just ok. I mainly make cortados and short lattes at home on a breville barista express. I have tried a lot of non-dairy barista options and there are other brands out there that steam/froth and taste much better for espresso drinks than Califa. This was my first time trying Califa because my fav brand was sold out at the store. I will not be reordering and cannot recommend, just fell flat in flavor and consistency.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent texture, great for steaming and better than Trader Joe's!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this oat milk! It's perfect for steaming for cappuccinos and lattes. Update 10/31/19: I tried Oat milk made by Trader Joe's, and it's nothing compared to this one! TJ's oat milk is watery and bland, it lacks flavor and texture, hence I will keep using Califia Farms.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: It's just like the milk, but doesn't fluff
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard time like the rest of the reviewer, trying to make this fluff or steam. It does not steam at all, cold or hot, no matter how much I use the frother. Worst of all, if you froth it for too long, it separates the oil from it and taste very bland. So, don't froth it long if it doesn't give you the froth you want. On the more positive point: you can use as a normal almond milk for coffee, cereal, and baking.
customer_reviews.author: Queen of Books

customer_reviews.title: VeryCloseToExpiration BE AWARE
customer_reviews.text: Ok- all the reviews I read said 6 month shelf life. My box, 6 cartons, expires in 3 months. So much for stocking up. When I buy this in the store it has a 2 year expiration date. I will not be buying from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Lightens my tea well!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried every brand of oat milk I’ve encountered, which, in my metropolitan area, amounts to dozens of brands. I swiftly come back to Califia Farm’s barista blend. It makes my morning tea light in color (no small feat, apparently, for oat milk) and taste delicious. It’s a little pricey, but when I consider the amount of oat milk I’ve had to donate because it didn’t meet the high standards of Califia Farms, I believe it’s worth every extra penny.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to nut or soy milk in tea and coffee.
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing. Tastes so much better than soy or almond milk in coffee. My Doctor wants me off dairy and I just can’t drink coffee without milk. I tried soy then almond and I don’t care for the grassy taste of them in coffee. They are fine alone or in cereal. It is higher in calorie than soy or almond, more along the calorie of 2% milk. Great tip shake it before you open and pour into your coffee or tea. It gives it a richer creamier taste.
customer_reviews.author: S. Speed

customer_reviews.title: NOT returnable. Read description well. Got 5 instead of 6 & have no recourse.
customer_reviews.text: Says you receive 6. I received 5. Had no clue it wasn’t returnable (my own fault for not looking & I never thought I would need to return it!) EDIT!!! Bought two kinds and used the other kind, not this one. No clue about the flavor. Bought it for two lactose intolerant sons. It has more fat for flavor, but is very expensive. Was expecting 6 cartons and got 5. Now it’s even more expensive than I had already thought. Ugh.
customer_reviews.author: Julie C.

customer_reviews.title: Good only for 5 months!
customer_reviews.text: This product says it has a long shelf life? Not really sure about that because the expiration date is August 2020. Not a very long shelf life when the expiration date is just around the corner! I must have gotten the supply that the company was anxious to get rid of?
customer_reviews.author: CMMacy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't foam in my Nespresso frother
customer_reviews.text: This did not foam in my Nespresso frother. Definitely NOT Barista quality. I bought it expressly for the purpose of creating foamed milk. Not the frother - the Barista blend oat milk I bought - Oatly ( works really well. This Califia Farms brand didn't foam at all.
customer_reviews.author: Deirdre O.

customer_reviews.title: Almond milk won't foam. It just won't. Not even Elvis can make it foam.
customer_reviews.text: I've made almond milk lattes for years and this one just won't foam. I bought the product to try to up the flavor and improve my latte art. This was a huge let-down. It's a drag that the ratings for all the different flavors are taken into account for the displayed rating. Nearly no one has given the almond milk a good review as it has an inability to foam.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey W. Larvenz

customer_reviews.title: Very oily
customer_reviews.text: It’s better for me to mix this with cold drinks. If it’s put in hot coffee or matcha there’s thick layer of the sunflower seed oil that’s really off putting
customer_reviews.author: Hal Ami

customer_reviews.title: I require whole milk in my coffee
customer_reviews.text: I am one of those people who use whole milk in their coffee. A lot of whole milk. I've tried all of the milk alternatives (almond, coconut, macadamia nut, hemp, other oat milks, etc.) and every brand that makes each. Califia Farms Oatmilk is hands down my favorite. So much so that I purchased 6 cases of it a few wks ago! My only complaint... my coupon didn't go through but as far as the product goes I highly recommend it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Great price and delicious!
customer_reviews.text: Great taste and excellent price! I got a steal buy subscribing and catching a promotion. I’m saving almost $2 a container buying this on Amazon rather than the grocery store. Love the ability to create a foamy latte.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Lewin

customer_reviews.title: Great Tasting Oat Milk
customer_reviews.text: I love this oat milk, way better than anything else I have tried at my grocery store. We only drink almond milk and oat milk, and after watching someone on Youtube recommend this milk, we gave it a try, it's delicious!!
customer_reviews.author: Hawker

customer_reviews.title: Be careful! Arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: Update- I reordered and one of the milks Arrived without a lid... considering the price has gone up I’d stick to buying at the grocery store. Didn’t feel safe drinking an opened container Arrived in less than a day and way cheaper than the grocery store. I prefer this oat milk over all other brands and it froths very well. The lid does leak sometimes but I can get past that. Highly recommend! (Especially at this cheap price)
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Delicious
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this purchase, a new stable in our pantry, great in coffee or by itself!
customer_reviews.author: James W.

customer_reviews.title: It froths!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Unlike other types of oat milk, this froths beautifully for hot drinks and tastes very close to (what I remember of) real milk. No added sugar!!!! And I love have a whole box that doesn't need to be refrigerated, I just pop one in when I finish the last one. I totally miss dairy (weird new dairy sensitivity) but this helps soooo much.
customer_reviews.author: sanderling

customer_reviews.title: Non diary alternative
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a non diary alternative for my espresso every morning. I was using half and half and switched to this. I don't miss my half and half anymore. This is so tasty and way better than almond milk..in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Preslie Long

customer_reviews.title: Not really frothable
customer_reviews.text: I have a real milk steaming cappuccino maker, and I am dairy free. I was really hoping this was going to make my lattes feel more like what you get at the coffee store. They're just almond milk, they don't necessarily taste greater than just what comes in regular cartons and they do not froth well. I've just ended up using them as milk....not worth putting in the steamer
customer_reviews.author: honeybees

customer_reviews.title: the best milk for cafe style drinks
customer_reviews.text: MY FAVORITE oat milk! This is the best tasting and has the best consistency for coffee drinks and drinking. I love this more than oatly for creating lattes and cappuccinos and hot chocolate drinks. Love the value I get through my subscription and go through these very quickly!! There are lots of great oat milks that work for different purposes but this is my all time favorite for cafe drinks.
customer_reviews.author: ss.lee

customer_reviews.title: Rich, creamy and worth it
customer_reviews.text: Smooth, rich and flavorful. Purchased this when other products were unavailable, using this almond milk in cappuccino during shelter in place. This will spoil you for other brands. Hard to go back to inferior brands after this.
customer_reviews.author: Maj. Paiger

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for coffee
customer_reviews.text: I’m vegan and this is the best alternative to milk, it’s creamy like milk without a heavy oat taste or nut taste like other types of milk. Highly recommend this brand, tried others and they were to oaty tasting.
customer_reviews.author: Trinity

customer_reviews.title: This is a DEAL!!!
customer_reviews.text: First off this milk is AMAZING!!! I usually can’t drink oat milk straight this brand(the Califia barista only) is delicious. You also save money by purchasing this on Amazon because it’s $4.99 in store for one.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Fine, but doesn’t froth like I expected “barista series” to do!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to make lattes from my nespresso machine. Does not froth like I expected “barista series” product to do though, so I use 1/2 this and 1/2 1% cow milk in my milk frother. It’s fine, but in prefer the “pacific” brand barista series almond milk, as it froths better. But...it was well-package and had far off expiration date! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: J & J

customer_reviews.title: YUM!!!
customer_reviews.text: Will always drink oat milk...bye bye almond milk. This is creamy and tastes great. LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great milk alternative
customer_reviews.text: This works great. Was using Oatley for a while. Loved the flavor but my shipments came in damaged and moldy. Tried Califia and noticed the larger pack shipped very well. Much better packaging so haven’t had any issues. Flavor, to me, is a bit more mellow than Oatley. But it works great with my barista machine.
customer_reviews.author: Jetmom23

customer_reviews.title: One of the best non-dairy milks I've tried!
customer_reviews.text: My family typically uses unsweetened almond milk for breakfast and drinking plain; that said, when we all tried this we all thought it was delicious! Great flavor and creaminess, and not too sweet. I was glad to see that it is unsweetened, it just naturally contains some sugars. I would love to see a larger size. Will definitely purchase again!!
customer_reviews.author: LGraham

customer_reviews.title: 🥛
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite oat milk. It has a great shelf life and can last a very long time before it is opened (then you have like a week or two) I don’t have any issue getting this to foam up. I use it with my Nespresso lattisima one machine and it foams and steams beautifully. My husband likes substituting this instead of regular milk in his cereal.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised by the taste and quality!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time trying oat milk. We usually buy almond milk in my household, but I thought I would give this a try. I was impressed by how well it blends into a cup of coffee, yet tastes light and fresh on a bowl of oatmeal or cereal. The taste is lighter than almond milk without losing the creaminess.
customer_reviews.author: Tchr67

customer_reviews.title: The best I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: This is truly the best brand of oat milk....no funky taste, no weird consistency, etc. I have tried others with some having a 'chunky' texture/consistency and I've had others that have a bitter taste but this one is the best I have tried! I use it for everything from coffee to cooking to baking.
customer_reviews.author: Meg M

customer_reviews.title: Finally!
customer_reviews.text: After trying all the other options, and being left wanting, we found this Oatmilk blend. It is very satisfying - for my wife and her morning cup of tea, and in my dark, rich cup of coffee. And once it passed those tests, I found you cannot beat the price on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Nixon

customer_reviews.title: no foam at all
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely no foam. Granted I use a little home frother from nespresso but it manages to get foam from all the other milk alternatives I've tried. I thought this would be the best option since its "barista blend" and now I'm stuck with 5 unopened cartons of horrible almond milk. Cool.
customer_reviews.author: maggiesticker

customer_reviews.title: Just like Starbucks
customer_reviews.text: This product tastes just like Starbucks' almond milk. I was on a mission to find a comparable almond milk because I LOVE their almond milk latte, but not the price (for daily enjoyment). I compared the ingredients and nutrition. This product most closely matched. I am very pleased! The packaging; however, needs a quality check. 4 of the 6 containers were smushed and crumpled. Thankfully, there were no breaks, so product is usable. It was just a bit disconserting.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely the closest product to cow's milk that I have ever found. So far. Way above all the others. It tastes good with cereal, drinking alone, or with a meal. Not chalky like some of the other oat milks and not so thick. It even has a thin texture like cow's milk. I do suggest shaking the box though.
customer_reviews.author: dragonlady

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Higher Price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Califia Farms Oat Milk Barista Blend several times over the last 8 months. Just now when wanting to reorder the price has risen $6.00 for the box of 6 shelf stable containers. Why is that? That notwithstanding, the product is very good for coffee, cereal, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jax Sage

customer_reviews.title: Best alternative for Oatly's!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't able to find Oatly's oatmilk anywhere so I tried this at my local coffee shop. It's almost a dupe of Oatly! Though not as "thick" the flavor is there and goes really great with mix-ins such as matcha or other types of tea! Will be ordering another batch as soon as I finish this one :D
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: It was creamy but didn't quite fill a void
customer_reviews.text: It tasted like milk nut creamer and with such high calories and buy products I'd rather just drink play ol creamer
customer_reviews.author: randy

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Well, we got addicted to New Barn Barista, but then it suddenly became difficult to locate. The Califa brand is a close second place. It's not quite as thick, but it'll do!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Mom

customer_reviews.title: I have been using this brand for my creamer for about two months
customer_reviews.text: I like the taste. I typically get the smaller containers that are almond and coconut cream. This one is different. It blends well and has a good taste. This one does have sweetener in it, so you also get calories and carbohydrates. But, sometimes, the tradeoff is just worth it to have a yummy cup of coffee. I got a box of six 32 ounce containers. No need to refrigerate until you open.
customer_reviews.author: CoCo's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent flavor/foam
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff! I was able to buy it at my local Whole Foods in Arizona but have since moved and they don’t carry it where I live now. This is a great price for the amount you get. I have an espresso machine with a milk steamer and this is my all time favorite almond milk to use for lattes. Not only does it produce good foam it also has the best flavor compared to other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Marin P

customer_reviews.title: Yum!
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered these three times now . Love the brand, the taste, the flexibility and that i can store them in the pantry until i need one in the fridge.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey Hall

customer_reviews.title: One of the better oat milks
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the better oat milks out there. Price is decent, it's shelf stable and the flavour is better than most other oat milk brands out there. I'd generally drink either this or Oatly. However, Califia is extra oily which I don't like. When I pour this into my tea, I can see oily drops on the top.
customer_reviews.author: K00

customer_reviews.title: Shipping Damage
customer_reviews.text: I like the product. It was well packed, but the bottoms looked like they were bent out of shape. The cartons were completely intact though. I sat 5 of them on my cabinet shelf and came back to find all but one had slowly been leaking...leaving a very gross wet and crusty mess. Almond milk has arrived perfectly each time so I don't know if this was just really poor handling and atypical, or if this is just one of those things you don't put through shipping. Trying once more because I love having these on hand without carrying all of them back from the store [I don't have a car].
customer_reviews.author: lipglossfreak

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product after running out of their regular shelf stable unsweetened creamer. This product does not have any coconut milk in it and I end up using twice as much to achieve the flavor I prefer. I have since purchased Better Half unsweetened creamer by Califia Farms and greatly prefer that over this product. I will not purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: The closest Plant base milk that imitate dairy milk
customer_reviews.text: Best milk substitute ever, i use this for my latte’s and so far is one of the best plant base milk that imitate same dairy milk texture for latte art, and doesn’t have strong oat flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Josue Pagan

customer_reviews.title: Great product, bummer shipping (for me)
customer_reviews.text: I really like this oatmilk, I use my frother and it turns out great. Definitely recommend for at home lattes. The only bummer was that 2 of the cartons leaked in the box but there's no option to get them replaced rather than returning the entire box which is too much of a pain during quarantine.
customer_reviews.author: Alysha Moder

customer_reviews.title: Really excited
customer_reviews.text: I’ve gone away from cow milk because it’s not easy on digestion, this milk is great, no problem. Even my dog tried a sample. The shelf stable 2 percent had sold out of a previous brand. That stuff was great and this is a sub, I’ll definitely get more later. Delivered on time with no delay.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Best Oat Milk for Espresso Drinks!
customer_reviews.text: This oat milk is nice and creamy--the perfect alternative to dairy milk in cappuccinos and lattes. Other types of oat milk don't hold up well (too thin), but this one is great! When used in espresso drinks, I don't taste the difference between this and regular milk.
customer_reviews.author: CaliforniaFitMom

product_meta.title: Califia Farms - Oat Milk, Unsweetened Barista Blend, 32 Oz (Pack of 6) | Shelf Stable | Non Dairy Milk | Creamer | Vegan | Plant Based | Gluten-Free | Non-GMO
product_meta.description: Flavor:Unsweetened Oatmilk| *:MilkOur new Oat Barista Blend steams beautifully, perfectly pairs with coffee, and tastes great by itself. It’s also unsweetened, made with whole rolled, gluten free oats and has no gums or stabilizers
feature_bullets: Our popular Oat milk barista blend - Steams beautifully, perfectly pairs with coffee and tastes delicious by itself. Milk or Creamer you choose
Made from North American grown whole rolled, gluten free oats
Nut free, allergen-free, soy free, non-GMO Project Verified, gluten-free, kosher and shelf stable

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
